medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe sudden-onset periorbital pain and increasing swelling and proptosis of the left eye, accompanied by complete ophthalmoplegia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began three weeks prior to hospitalization, characterized by severe periorbital pain and progressive exophthalmos. The pain and swelling worsened over this period despite initial treatment with intravenous antibiotics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ehlersâ€“Danlos syndrome (EDS) Type IV; diabetes mellitus.
medical_history.family_history: Her father died at age 39 from an intracranial hemorrhage, and one of her three sisters died at age 30 from an abdominal aortic aneurysm rupture.
